comment: Matt is definitely one of the best and easiest professors I have had! I feel like I gained what I needed to out of the class while still making a solid A. I don't know if he is teaching at KSU in the Spring but seriously one of the best. I would take him for every class I can.

Matt is a great professor, but I believe this is his last semester at KSU. He talked about things that actually mattered, like how to get jobs and internships. But I didn't really get anything out of the class, and I'm nervous that this will make the higher level research class much harder because he is no longer teaching it. 3 abstracts, 2 tests.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Would take again

comment: This is one of two classes I've ever enjoyed in my entire college career. The content was so relevant and interesting I found myself teaching what I was learning to friends outside the course. Matt is fun, chill, funny, and easy. He'll cancel class a lot but it will never make you fall behind. Would take him again if i could!

Matt was a great professor and is very passionate about his students. He's engaging to listen to, super easy class but I don't feel like I learned a whole lot. A lot of what he taught was real-world applications, which I can respect - you don't get that in most classes. He did cancel class a lot....a lot a lot.

Matt is the greatest professor ever! Yeah, there are pop quizzes but he drops the lowest one. Took him at 9:30a and he makes getting up for class worth it. Typically lets class out early and is super laid back about grades and attendance.

I loved taking Matt's class! He teaches you things that are actually applicable to the real world. He is a funny guy and a great teacher. I'm not one who usually participates in class but he makes it so easy to get involved in discussion. Take this guy!

I LOVE Matt. He's super funny and made a 9:30am class really fun to go to. He's very passionate and you can see that in his lectures. There's a lot of hard reading, but honestly if you just go look up summaries it's a lot easier to understand and talk about in discussions. Definitely would recommend taking Matt's classes!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: This is the 2nd class ive taken with Hale & im sad I won't get to take any more with him. He's a great professor who really cares more about taking knowledge from the class than getting a good grade. Definitely, take him if you can & get on the waitlist if you can't like I did!

Hale gives great lectures! We delve into controversial topics and have really great conversations. Grades are two test, not cumulative and some pop quizzes and activitys to drive home the material. Class is pretty easy if you attend and engage in lectures. Attendance is not mandatory.

Hale is a great professor. He gets right to the point, giving you the information and then you do a mini-project on what you learned. He is laid-back and lenient. He doesn't take attendance and an easy grader. I would definitely take him!

One of the most interesting, thought-provoking classes I've even taken. No busy work, just weekly readings that you discuss in class (all of them are enjoyable/interesting so don't worry.) He really cares a lot about his students and it shows. If you can get into one of his classes, do yourself a favor and take it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: In my three years at KSU, Matt has been the first instructor that really changed my college career. I took away so much more from this class than I have from any other class. He is very insightful and intelligent, but still always willing to listen to his students. He challenges his students to think deeper, but doesn't overload us with work.

If you're able to take him, DO IT. He genuinely wants all of his students to succeed in this course. This class can be pretty dry, but he actually offers real world information that college students can relate to. Seriously, take him, you will not regret it.
SO HOT. great teacher always willing to help. easy subject matter
Matts great! His class is boring and sometimes he try's too hard to fit in, but overall cool dude! You don't need the book I never even opened it and I got a A.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Hale is very caring, kind, and fun! The reason why so many students love him is because he teaches everything in entertaining ways. He talks to his students a lot and wants you to succeed in the future. He doesn't give out much assignments but they are graded heavily so just show effort, do well, and you will be fine. He is just great.

Absolutely loved Matt's class. He is so caring and genuinely loves all his students and wants them to succeed. He lets the students pick topics to talk about, such as how to apply for scholarships, how to get internships, how to write cover letters, etc and is very insightful. Hands down the best professor I have ever had. 11/10. Plus he's hot.

Great professor, who is willing to work with you. Only assigns homework that is valuable to the class and the student (ie no busy work). Would definitely take him again, and would highly recommend him. Great professor, do yourself a favor and take his class!

Professor Hale is probably the coolest teacher I've had so far at KSU. He's young and is more relatable. He doesn't lecture hard and wants you to participate in conversations as a tool for learning. I didn't need the book but I did skim over it. All the work is easy and he explains/ answers all questions for you. The Midterm and Final are at home.

Hale is one of the coolest teachers ever. He's really chill and laid back. He really cares about the class and making sure you LEARN something. Be ready to do a lot of APA citations. Final and Midterm are take home. Abstracts but no final paper. You should read the textbook but it won't be detrimental if you dont.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: AWESOME. Helpful, cares about his students, clearly wants the best for them. Actually learned things I will use after the class is over. Good contact for after graduation when job searching. Highly recommend, cool guy.

Professor hale is by far the BEST professor I've ever had. He is absolutely hysterical and is one of the most genuine people I've ever met. He cares about every single one of his students and wants everyone to not only succeed in class, but in life as well. LOVE LOVE LOVE him

LOVE LOVE LOVE him sooooo much! He is the BEST prof at KSU. Everyone should take him, he is really easy to work with, smart, and funny! Glad I had the opportunity to take him! HE IS A MUST TAKE!!!! He also dresses nice and has cool hair...

Drop everyone else and take this class. He is so easy to work with, hilarious, and if I could take him again I would. He really cares about your future and finding the easiest and simplest ways to help you through college. You won't regret taking him.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof. Hale is the BEST professor I have taken at KSU (I'm a junior) he cares about his students learning only what we need to, not all the other junk. He is super funny and teaches real life material. Great Professor, I wish he taught more classes because I would be the first to sign up! Take him, you won't regret it.

Professor Hale, has been one of my favorite professors to ever take! He makes lectures interesting! He cuts to the chase on topics that we have to learn! He gives great feedback! He makes the class fun and learning easy! Would take again hands down! Midterm and Final are easy if you pay attention, mostly common sense! never overwhelmed with work!

He equips you with everything you need to tackle college and the real world. He doesn't just sit there and drill the textbook into our minds. He is genuinely interested in source and investigation and makes what would be a boring class energic and interesting. He also taught us about resumes, notetaking apps, scholarships accessible to us.
